## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:


## Including Plots

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(janitor)
library(lubridate)
```

```{r}
nanno_1<-readr::read_csv("ph_nanno_1.csv")
```
```{r}
nanno_2<-readr::read_csv("ph_nanno_2.csv")
```
```{r}
nanno_1<-clean_names(nanno_1)
```

```{r}
glimpse(nanno_1)
```
```{r}
nanno_1%>%
  select(-c(x8))
```
```{r}
nanno_1<-nanno_1 %>% 
rename(ph1_7_6 = ph_7_6_2,
       ph1_8_2 = ph_8_2_3,
       ph2_7_6 = ph_7_6_4,
       ph2_8_2 = ph_8_2_5,
       ph3_8_2 = ph_8_2_6, 
       ph3_7_6 = ph_7_6_7)
```
```{r}
nanno_1
```
```{r}
glimpse(nanno_1)
```

```{r}
nanno_1
```
`
```{r}
nanno_1<-nanno_1[,c(1,2,4,7,3,5,6)]
```
```{r}
nanno_1
```
```{r}
nanno_1_long<- nanno_1 %>% 
  pivot_longer( 
    ph1_7_6:ph3_8_2,
    names_to = c("ph_set"),
    values_to = "ph_values")
nanno_1_long
```
```{r}
nanno_1_long %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=relative_time,y=ph_values,color=ph_set))+
  geom_point()+
  geom_line()+
  facet_grid()+
  labs(x="Time",y="pH")
```
